bio: Liran Tal is a software developer, and a GitHub Star, world-recognized for his activism in open source communities and advancing web and Node.js security. He engages in security research through his work in the OpenJS Foundation and the Node.js ecosystem security working group, and further promotes open source supply chain security as an OWASP project lead. Liran is also a published author of Essential Node.js Security and O'Reilly's Serverless Security. At Snyk, he is leading the developer advocacy team and on a mission to empower developers with better dev-first security.

sessions.name: Securing AI-Powered Applications: A Developer's Guide
Defending Against Multi-Agent Attacks in Production

bio:
Randall runs Developer Relations & Community at Snyk, where he works on security research, development, and education. In his spare time, Randall writes articles and gives talks advocating for security best practices. Randall also builds and contributes to various open-source security tools.

Randall's realms of expertise include Python, JavaScript, and Go development, web security, cryptography, and infrastructure security. Randall has been writing software for over 20 years and has built a number of popular API services and open-source tools.

sessions.name: Securing Autonomous AI Workflows: Lessons from the Field

bio: John Doe is a security software engineer who works at Acme Security. He is a security expert and has a passion for building secure applications.

sessions.name: MCP Servers: Security Friend or Foe?

bio: Sarah Johnson is a senior frontend engineer and performance optimization specialist with over 8 years of experience in JavaScript development. She has worked at companies like Google, Netflix, and currently leads the performance team at a major e-commerce platform. Sarah is passionate about making the web faster and has contributed to several open-source performance monitoring tools. She regularly speaks at conferences about JavaScript optimization and has written extensively about web performance best practices.

sessions.name: JavaScript Performance Optimization: From Theory to Practice

bio: Michael Chen is a TypeScript architect and software engineering consultant with expertise in building scalable enterprise applications. He has over 10 years of experience in full-stack development and has helped numerous companies migrate from JavaScript to TypeScript. Michael is a TypeScript contributor and maintains several popular open-source libraries. He's known for his deep understanding of TypeScript's type system and has given workshops on advanced TypeScript patterns at major conferences worldwide.

sessions.name: Advanced TypeScript Patterns for Enterprise Applications
